files.description: Documents the atomic-claim schema, labeling rules, reference corpus format, retrieval/audit pipeline usage, and tiered false-accept/abstain metrics.
Defines project metadata, runtime dependencies (e.g., pydantic, numpy, scikit-learn), and console entry points for running audits.
Exposes the public package API for claim schema, retrieval, auditing, and metrics computation.

Implements the atomic-claim schema with machine-readable fields (IDs, subject/predicate/object, qualifiers, timeframe, modality, normalization) and label definitions (supported/unsupported/insufficient).
Loads and validates a small curated reference corpus (documents and evidence spans) from JSONL/YAML and provides search-ready text views plus metadata.
Provides a lightweight retrieval layer (BM25/TF-IDF) over the reference corpus with top-k evidence selection and deterministic scoring.
Runs claim-level audits by retrieving evidence for each atomic claim, applying decision logic to assign supported/unsupported/insufficient, and emitting per-claim rationales and traces.
Computes tiered metrics including false-accept rate, abstain rate, coverage, and confusion matrices by confidence tier and label.
Handles reading/writing atomic claims, audit outputs, and metric reports in JSONL with stable schemas and versioning fields.
Implements a CLI to validate inputs, build/load the corpus index, run audits, and print/save tiered metric summaries.
Provides a small curated reference corpus with a handful of documents and evidence spans used for retrieval-backed claim audits.
Contains example atomic claims with gold labels to demonstrate auditing and enable end-to-end evaluation of false-accept/abstain metrics.

missionDescription: Define an atomic-claim schema + labels (supported/unsupported/insufficient) and build a small curated reference corpus + retrieval layer to run claim-level audits and compute tiered false-accept/abstain metrics.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Establishes claim-level verification as the default handling for borderline-confidence queries, which is the core unit needed for risk-tier labeling, abstention metrics, and claim-aggregation decision...
